oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian bat ceramic figurine head
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian hollow ceramic figure possibly depicting a monkey. Figure has large ears as well has fangs. The facial features are all incised and the figure stops at the neck but no breakage in the area shows that this is purposeful. There is a hole in the back of the figure directly under an inscribed "E-T".
Overall good condition with regular wear of facial features.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
